result.execSummary:
The defendant Lola M Olds was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Huber with standard release conditions.  Sentence Credit for 3 days granted if revoked.

miscConds.notes:
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.
DNA Surcharge waived.
Comply with mental health treatment/counseling.  Follow through with the visiting nurse appointments.

No Further law violations.
If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lola M Olds in court with attorney John P. Marchan.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court orders the following:
- 4 months Huber with standard release conditions. STAYED.  Credit for 3 days if revoked.
- 1 year 6 months Probation. 
- Court costs of $278.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- DNA Surcharge waived
- Conditions of Probation:  Comply with mental health treatment/counseling.  Follow through with the visiting nurse appointments.  No further law violations.
Sentencing hearing on September 12, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
